Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a video that is not related to the current lockdown in South Africa.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is from a previous incident and not related to the ongoing lockdown.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video is evidence of the lockdown in South Africa collapsing and people looting shops due to unemployment and lack of money.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video is from a previous incident of looting unrelated to the current lockdown situation.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that the video is not recent and does not represent the current situation in South Africa during the lockdown.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by presenting the video as evidence of the lockdown collapsing, when in fact it is unrelated to the lockdown.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by presenting the video as evidence of widespread looting during the lockdown, when it is not related to the lockdown at all.
